text.headline: Rolling Sands
text.text:
Rolling Sands Golf Course Major Final Site Plan application to Martin County, Florida - Request by Creech Consulting, Inc. on behalf of SS Ranch, LLC for permit approval of a Major Final Site Plan to develop an 18-hole private golf course using golf course architect Tom Doak. The project includes a one-story clubhouse, pro shop, maintenance building, two cottages, a helicopter pad. The filing outlines a proposal to reconfigure 20 acres of the approximate 240-acre property to retain as a residential lot. The property is located between Okeechobee Waterway (aka St. Lucie Canal) and SW Kanner Highway approximately 6.5 miles west of Interstate 95.

Tom Doak is a well traveled golf course architect known for naturalistic/minimalistic designs. His other golf design in Florida is his work at Streamsong Resort, a golf resort in Polk County, Florida. The site is a former phosphate mining site, characterized by rolling sand dunes and expansive vistas. It is a firm, bouncy course with natural features of the land, emphasizing the rugged beauty of the terrain. Streamsong Blue is characterized by wide fairways, strategic bunkers, and undulating greens. The course is designed to be easily walkable creating a good atmosphere at the resort.
